metadata.title: USN-6880-1 -- Tomcat vulnerability
metadata.description: Sam Shahsavar discovered that Apache Tomcat did not properly reject  HTTP requests with an invalid Content-Length header. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to perform HTTP request smuggling attacks.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6880-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libtomcat8-embed-java - 8.5.39-1ubuntu1~18.04.3+esm1 libtomcat8-java - 8.5.39-1ubuntu1~18.04.3+esm1 tomcat8 - 8.5.39-1ubuntu1~18.04.3+esm1 tomcat8-admin - 8.5.39-1ubuntu1~18.04.3+esm1 tomcat8-common - 8.5.39-1ubuntu1~18.04.3+esm1 tomcat8-docs - 8.5.39-1ubuntu1~18.04.3+esm1 tomcat8-examples - 8.5.39-1ubuntu1~18.04.3+esm1 tomcat8-user - 8.5.39-1ubuntu1~18.04.3+esm1 Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro  libtomcat9-embed-java - 9.0.16-3ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm1 libtomcat9-java - 9.0.16-3ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm1 tomcat9 - 9.0.16-3ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm1 tomcat9-admin - 9.0.16-3ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm1 tomcat9-common - 9.0.16-3ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm1 tomcat9-docs - 9.0.16-3ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm1 tomcat9-examples - 9.0.16-3ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm1 tomcat9-user - 9.0.16-3ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm1 Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
